title: Client will not stay connected (restarts itself every time it disconnects)
body: I've had this issue for a long time, where my client simply wouldn't stay connected to the server and I'd frequently get disconnected. It wasn't a big deal with the old client because it would just drop me out of queue and it would generally just be an annoyance to my friends. But with the new client every time the client disconnects itself it restarts itself? There's a circular league icon with a loading bar thing circling around it. And then from there I have to manually restart the client otherwise I can't get into a game. I'm wondering if anyone has ever had a problem like this and found a fix? I don't have connection issues while I'm in game, it's just with the client and has never disconnected in champion select. I can still use chat features while I'm disconnecting. I used to live in a dormitory and I didn't have this problem but when I moved to a different place I started having problems. Fairly annoying, anyone have any potential fixes?

replies.body:
Your connection specifically to the Maestro service and some of the PvP.net services could be poor. This is usually what causes these types of crashes and disconnections. I recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), as it covers the most common solutions for this type of issue.

Let me know if this worked for you.
I've gone through these and I still haven't found a fix, not entirely sure what's going on. What other potential fixes could I try?

This is likely something more complicated along your network routing. If you run a set of system logs using our [HRT App](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach them to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), we'll be able to assist further.
